AREA IX – Laboratories
PARAMETER A – LABORATORIES, SHOPS, AND
FACILITIES
I. SYSTEMS – INPUTS AND PROCESSES
 The layout of the campus is presented showing
the location of the laboratory rooms/ shops
utilized in the program and its conformity to RA
6541- National Building Code of the Philippines &
PD 856 – Code of Sanitation of the Philippines.

Brief description of Computer Laboratory
a. Laboratory layout conforms to acceptable
standard for the program
b. Laboratories are well-equipped and properly lighted and ventilated for effective learning
c. Furniture are properly arranged and safety
devices are installed.
d. Trainings on emergency preparedness were
conducted to cope with emergency
situations.
Area IX: Laboratories 9

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
e. Equipment was purchased to at least equal
the CHED minimum requirements.
f. Personnel were hired to augment the
workforce in maintaining the cleanliness and proper maintenance of equipment and
facilities to ascertain good working
conditions.
g. The laboratory follow the provisions required
by CHED.
h. There is a request for additional computers
and installation of new programs.
i. There is a regular purchase of laboratory supplies, materials and equipment

III. OUTCOMES
 There are evidences that laboratories and shops
are well-equipped, functional, and are conducive
to learning
Checking the computer units to maintain its
functionality
Area IX: Laboratories 11

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Students occupy the computer laboratory
IV. BEST PRACTICES
 The laboratory serve as an avenue to the
development of students’ skills which is vital for
their profession. In order for it to perform its
functions, the laboratory users abide to sufficient
practices in order to maintain its quality and to
provide students a well-pleasing work area.
 At the beginning of the semester, the
students were oriented with the guidelines
they should abide while working in the
laboratory.
 The students were oriented with the location
and use of the first-aid kits, fire extinguishers
Area IX: Laboratories 12

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
and other safety devices available in the
laboratory.
 Precautionary measures are discussed
before the proper laboratory sessions.
 The use of various laboratory tools and
equipment were demonstrated by the
laboratory technician and the faculty among
the students.
 The lights, air conditioner, and other
equipment were strictly monitored/turned off
right after the class to minimize the use of
electricity with exception to some equipment
placed within laboratory premises which are
under use.
 Every day, before and after classes, the
utility personnel clean the laboratory rooms
and maintain the arrangements of chairs and
tables and other furniture in the laboratory.
 The number of chairs in the laboratory
rooms was minimized to allow mobility while
working.
 The utilization of the laboratory rooms were
bounded to a limited number of students
each room to maximize the capacity of the
laboratory.
Area IX: Laboratories 13

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
 In using the laboratories during periods beyond
class hours, a request letter approved by the
dean of the requesting party should be addressed
to the laboratory technician and the department chair beforehand
Area IX: Laboratories 14

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE

MATERIALS
I. SYSTEMS – INPUTS AND PROCESSES
 The equipment, supplies, and materials are

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE

Area IX: Laboratories 16

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Area IX: Laboratories 17

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
III. OUTCOMES
a. There is evidence that laboratory equipment,
supplies, and materials are sufficient and wisely
utilized.
Area IX: Laboratories 17
PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Laboratory facilities are always available to be
utilized
Area IX: Laboratories 19

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
IV. BEST PRACTICES
 Equipment, supplies and materials are the most
vital necessities in order to work in the laboratory.
The quality of the equipment and availability
should be maintained in order to obtain valuable
skills from the activities. The equipment, supplies
and materials in the laboratory are maintained
through the following practices:
 Every beginning of the semester, the students
were introduced with the basic uses and
functions of various laboratory equipment.
Hands-on training and practical exams are
also conducted during laboratory sessions
under the supervision of the faculty.
 There is a log sheet which registers the name
of the user, time and date of usage,
supervising personnel and the user’s
signature. It allows monitoring of the use of the
equipment, troubleshooting of the possible
occurring problems and tracing of the person
responsible for the possible occurring
problems.
 The number and availability of laboratory
supplies and equipment are frequently
subjected to inventory for estimating the
Area IX: Laboratories 20

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
specific number of pieces needed for purchase
request.
 The faculty always coordinate with the
laboratory technician to monitor the materials
necessary for the upcoming laboratory
activities.
 A stock of accessories for certain laboratory
equipment is available under the supervision
of the laboratory technician.
Area IX: Laboratories 21

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
PARAMETER C – MAINTENANCE
I. SYSTEMS – INPUTS AND PROCESSES
 Competent staff are assigned in the upkeep of the
laboratory
Area IX: Laboratories 22

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Area IX: Laboratories 23

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Area IX: Laboratories 24

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
 There is available maintenance and repair unit in
the campus.
Area IX: Laboratories 25

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
II. IMPLEMENTATION
 The maintenance system of the laboratories and
equipment is described briefly as follows:
1. Computer Laboratory
The laboratory custodian maintains the
organization of laboratories and the condition of
every tool and equipment. During usage,
malfunction of equipment or tools are directly
reported to the laboratory custodian who
performs necessary remedy; in case of total
malfunction, the problem is submitted to the
campus maintenance group. Inventory of tools
which are commonly used in laboratory classes
is frequently conducted. Tools and equipment
that have been lost which are proven to be the
students’ negligence are recorded and the
responsible student should replace the exact
same tool as soon as possible.
The cleanliness of the laboratory is
maintained by the students before and after the
class, as well as the utility personnel.
Area IX: Laboratories 26

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all computers in computer
laboratory is every semestral break.
 Safety devices are available.
There are signages displayed prominently in
the laboratory room and electrical lines are
safely installed. There are also readily
accessible first aid kit and fire extinguisher.
Laboratory Safety Device Quantity
First Aid kit 1 Computer
Laboratory Fire 1 extinguisher
Area IX: Laboratories 27

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
III. OUTCOMES
 The laboratories and shops are functional and are
properly maintained.
Functional computers in the computer laboratory
Area IX: Laboratories 28

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Computer maintenance is being conducted.
Computer calibration is also performed
Area IX: Laboratories 29

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
IV. BEST PRACTICES
 The laboratory technician maintains the
orderliness of laboratory and the quality of the
equipment.
 Visual monitoring is always conducted.
 The laboratory technician always performs
trouble shooting when the equipment
malfunctions. A test run is conducted when
the equipment will be used.
 Tools and equipment that have been
damaged due to students’ negligence will be
recorded in the laboratory technician’s log
book and the student should immediately
replace or compensate the damaged cause.
 If the damage on tools and equipment were
caused by accident the students will not be
held liable. The laboratory technician will
report the damage to the immediate
supervisor.
 Electrical maintenance, roof and window
repair, installation of equipment, water supply
maintenance and other repair services are
done periodically or as necessary.
 The cleanliness of the laboratory rooms is
maintained by the utility personnel every day.
Area IX: Laboratories 30

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
 The students were tasked to maintain the
cleanliness of their working area during their
classes.
Area IX: Laboratories 31

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
PARAMETER D – SPECIAL PROVISIONS
I. SYSTEMS – INPUTS AND PROCESSES
 Describe specific program requirements in
accordance with policies/guidelines, CMO’s and
other legal issuances.
Area IX: Laboratories 32

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
Area IX: Laboratories 33

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
 There is an approved Project Procurement
Management Plan (PPMP); Annual Procurement
Plan where laboratory equipment is listed for
procurement.
Area IX: Laboratories 34

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
II. IMPLEMENTATION
 Present evidences that the laboratory equipment,
supplies, and materials are procured in
accordance with RA 9184.
Area IX: Laboratories 75

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
III. OUTCOMES
 Special provisions in the CMO of the program are
complied with.
Computers are utilized for learning
Area IX: Laboratories 84

PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE BSE
IV. BEST PRACTICES
 The laboratory technician frequently inventories
the available materials and tools.
 The laboratory technician prepares the list of
materials needed for purchase request.
 The canvassed equipment was included in the
PPMP and APP.
 In using the laboratories during periods beyond
class hours, a request letter approved by the
dean of the requesting party should be addressed
to the laboratory technician and the department
chair beforehand.
 Each laboratory equipment has its own log sheet
which registers the name of the user, time and
date of usage, supervising personnel and the
user’s signature. It allows monitoring of the use
of the equipment, troubleshooting of the possible
occurring problems and tracing of the person responsible for the possible occurring problems.
 The students utilizing computer laboratories were
allowed to access the internet for purposes of research and compliance of requirements for their
courses.
Area IX: Laboratories 85
